                    ### Question
                    Choose the drug which blocks basal as well as stimulated gastric acid secretion without affecting cholinergic, histaminergic or gastrin receptors

                    ### Options
                    opa. Loxatidine
opb. Pirenzepine
opc. Omeprazole
opd. Famotidine

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor that effectively blocks both basal and stimulated gastric acid secretion by inhibiting the H+/K+ ATPase in the gastric parietal cells. Importantly, it does this without affecting cholinergic, histaminergic, or gastrin receptors, aligning with the requirement of the question. In contrast, Loxatidine and Famotidine are H2 receptor antagonists, which specifically block histamine-induced gastric acid secretion and thus affect histaminergic receptors. Pirenzepine is an anticholinergic agent that blocks cholinergic receptors, which also disqualifies it from the criteria. Therefore, the only option that meets all criteria is Omeprazole.
